greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: For 0 <= R <= 255, let s(R,n) = eventual period of a single cell in a Rule R cellular automaton operating in a cyclic universe of width n; a(n) = max_R s(R,n)/n.
comment: It is only a (very plausible) conjecture that a(n) will always be an integer. If this should fail, the definition will have to be replaced by "the nearest integer to max_R s(R,n)/n", and the sequence will become much less interesting.
reference: Bradley Klee, Posting to Math Fun Mailing List, Apr 26 2020
link: Bradley Klee, Table giving R, then {s(R,1)..s(R,10} for 0 <= R <= 255
example: For R = 45, the sequence {s(R,1)..s(R,10} is 2,2,1,2,30,18,126,2,504,430 (see A334508), and s(45,10) = 430 is the greatest value of any s(R,10), so a(10) = 430/10 = 430.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 05 2020
